column1: #Text=Polycrystalline Dy germanate Dy2Ge2O7 was synthesized similar as described previously46,50: GeO2 (Heraeus, 99.999 %) and Dy2O3 (Chempur, 99.999 %) were used as starting materials.
#Text=Stoichiometric amounts were mixed with ethanol and thoroughly ground in an agate mortar until dryness.
#Text=The synthesis was performed in a “Walker-type” high-pressure apparatus51 with a 1000 t hydraulic press (Voggenreiter GmbH).
#Text=The powder mixture was filled in an h-BN capsule and compressed in an 18 mm zirconia octahedron pressure medium with a load of 970 t corresponding to a sample pressure of 8 GPa.
#Text=The pyrochlore material forms during a solid-state reaction at 1100 ◦C maintained for 90 min.
#Text=The temperature was measured with a Type C (W5%Re/W26%Re) thermocouple.
#Text=For the polycrystalline silicone-substituted Dy2Ge2-xSixO7 samples, SiO2 (Degussa Aerosil380, > 99.8 %) was used additionally.

#Text=The uni-axially prepressed samples were surrounded by CsCl capsules and compressed in 10 mm MgO:Cr octahedral pressure cells (Ceramic Substrate & Components Ltd.) with a load of 642 t which equals a sample pressure of approximately 16 GPa.
#Text=Si-containing pyrochlores were synthesized at 1100 ◦C for 90 to 180 min.
#Text=We recovered polycrystalline, sintered pieces of dark to light gray material after the high-pressure synthesis of Dy2Ge2-xSixO7 with x = 0, 0.02, 0.08, and 0.125.

#Text=The phase purity was confirmed via SEM/EDX analysis (Carl Zeiss LEO 1530) for all samples and via room-temperature x-ray powder diffraction at the ALBA synchrotron light source (Beamline 4, λ = 0.413 364 ˚A) in Barcelona, Spain, for Dy2Ge2O7 and by using a Seifert diffractometer (FPM URD6) in symmetric Bragg-Brentano-Geometry with Cu anode for Dy2Ge2-xSixO7 with x = 0.02, 0.08, and 0.125.
#Text=The software package Fullprof (Suite 3.00, 2015) was used for the Rietveld analysis to obtain the lattice constants.
